newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: SLOVAK CBANK ONE-DAY REPO RATE DOWN TO 16.32 PCT.
newsitem.headline: SLOVAK CBANK ONE-DAY REPO RATE DOWN TO 16.32 PCT.

text.p: The National Bank of Slovakia (NBS) on Wednesday said the average rate at its one-day securities repurchase tender fell to 16.32 percent, from 17.5 percent in the last similar tender on Monday.
The NBS added that it had allocated funds totalling 4.0 billion crowns, the full fixed amount it had offered in Wednesday's tender.
Last Friday, the NBS's three-day average repo rate rose to a record high of 21.2 percent.
The maximum bid in the tender was 18.00 percent, while the minimum bid rate was 15.5 percent, the NBS added.
The NBS said bids totalled 4.81 billion crowns.

According to official NBS figures, the banking sector is short of liquidity ahead of the minimum reserve period, with banks' minimum reserve demands fulfilled at 91.34 percent as of Tuesday. -- Bratislava Newsroom, 421-7-521-8402
